## <a name="gx_system_bidi_text_disable"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10652">gx_system_bidi_text_disable</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10652">gx_system_bidi_text_disable</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10653">Deshabilitar la compatibilidad de texto bidireccional dinámico</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10653">Disable dynamic bi-directional text support</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10654">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10654">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_bidi_text_disable(VOID);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10655">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10655">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10656">Este servicio deshabilita la compatibilidad de texto bidireccional dinámico.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10656">This service disables dynamic bi-directional text support.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10657">Este servicio requiere la definición de GX_DYNAMIC_BIDI_TEXT_SUPPORT al compilar la biblioteca GUIX y solo es necesario si se necesita reordenar en tiempo de ejecución los datos de cadenas bidireccionales.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10657">This service requires GX_DYNAMIC_BIDI_TEXT_SUPPORT to be defined when building the GUIX library, and is only required if runtime reordering of BiDi string data is needed.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10658">La mayoría de las aplicaciones usan GUIX Studio para generar correctamente cadenas de texto bidireccionales reordenadas.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10658">Most applications utilize GUIX Studio to produce correctly reorderd BiDi text strings.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10659">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10659">Parameters</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10660">**None**</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10660">**None**</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10661">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10661">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10662">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Deshabilitación correcta de la compatibilidad de texto bidireccional</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10662">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Successfully disabled bidi text support</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10663">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10663">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10664">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10664">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10665">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10665">Example</span></span>

```C
/* GX_DYNAMIC_BIDI_TEXT_SUPPORT is defined. */

/* Diable bidi text support. */
status = gx_system_bidi_text_disable();

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS, bidi text support was disabled. */
```

## <a name="gx_system_bidi_text_enable"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10668">gx_system_bidi_text_enable</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10668">gx_system_bidi_text_enable</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_bidi_text_enable(VOID);
```

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10672">Este servicio habilita la compatibilidad de texto bidireccional dinámico.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10672">This service enables dynamic bi-directional text support.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10673">Este servicio requiere la definición de GX_DYNAMIC_BIDI_TEXT_SUPPORT al compilar la biblioteca GUIX y solo es necesario si se necesita reordenar en tiempo de ejecución los datos de cadenas bidireccionales.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10673">This service requires GX_DYNAMIC_BIDI_TEXT_SUPPORT to be defined when building the GUIX library, and is only required if runtime reordering of BiDi string data is needed.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10674">La mayoría de las aplicaciones usan GUIX Studio para generar correctamente cadenas de texto bidireccionales reordenadas.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10674">Most applications utilize GUIX Studio to produce correctly reordered BiDi text strings.</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10678">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Habilitación correcta de la compatibilidad de texto bidireccional</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10678">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successfully enabled bidi text support</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10679">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10679">Allowed From</span></span>

## <a name="gx_system_canvas_refresh"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10684">gx_system_canvas_refresh</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10684">gx_system_canvas_refresh</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10685">Actualizar todos los lienzos con modificaciones</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10685">Refresh all dirty canvases</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10686">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10686">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_canvas_refresh(VOID);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10687">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10687">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10688">Este servicio fuerza volver a dibujar inmediatamente todos los widgets y lienzos con modificaciones.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10688">This service forces an immediate redrawing of all dirty widgets and canvases.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10689">Por lo general, el componente del sistema GUIX invoca este servicio internamente, pero la aplicación puede llamarlo para forzar una operación inmediata de redibujo del sistema.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10689">This service is normally invoked internally by the GUIX system component, but can be called by the application to force an immediate system redrawing operation.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10690">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10690">Parameters</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10691">**None**</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10691">**None**</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10692">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10692">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10693">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Liberación correcta del bloque de animación</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10693">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successfully released animation block</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10694">**GX_INVALID_CANVAS** (0x20) No se ha creado ningún lienzo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10694">**GX_INVALID_CANVAS**: (0x20) No canvas created</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10695">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10695">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10696">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10696">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10697">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10697">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10698">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10698">Example</span></span>

```C
/* Force immediate redraw operation. */
status = gx_system_canvas_refresh();

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS, canvas has been redraw. */
```

## <a name="gx_system_dirty_mark"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10723">gx_system_dirty_mark</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10723">gx_system_dirty_mark</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10724">Marcar área modificada</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10724">Mark area dirty</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10725">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10725">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_dirty_mark(GX_WIDGET *widget);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10726">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10726">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10727">Este servicio marca el área de este widget como modificada.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10727">This service marks the area of this widget as dirty.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10728">En la práctica, esto pone en cola el widget para volverlo a dibujar cuando se ha completado el procesamiento de eventos del sistema.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10728">This effectively queues the widget for redrawing when the system event processing has been completed.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10729">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10729">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10730">**widget**: puntero al bloque de control de widget.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10730">**widget**: Pointer to widget control block</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10731">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10731">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10732">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Se marcó correctamente el widget como modificado</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10732">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successfully marked widget dirty</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10733">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10733">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10734">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10734">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10735">**GX_INVALID_WIDGET** (0x12) Widget no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10735">**GX_INVALID_WIDGET**: (0x12) Widget not valid</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10736">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10736">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10737">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10737">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10738">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10738">Example</span></span>

```C
/* Mark widget “my_widget” as dirty. */
status = gx_system_dirty_mark(&my_widget);

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS the area associated
   with “my_widget” has been marked as dirty. */
```

## <a name="gx_system_dirty_partial_add"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10763">gx_system_dirty_partial_add</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10763">gx_system_dirty_partial_add</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10764">Marcar el área parcial como modificada</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10764">Mark partial area dirty</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10765">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10765">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_dirty_partial_add(
    GX_WIDGET *widget,
    GX_RECTANGLE *dirty_area);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10766">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10766">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10767">Este servicio marca el área parcial de este widget como modificada.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10767">This service marks the partial area of this widget as dirty.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10768">Pone en cola el widget para volverlo a dibujar mediante la operación de actualización del lienzo de GUIX cuando se haya completado el procesamiento de eventos del sistema.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10768">This queues the widget for redrawing by the GUIX canvas refresh operation when the system event processing has been completed.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10769">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10769">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10770">**widget**: puntero al bloque de control de widget.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10770">**widget**: Pointer to widget control block</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10771">**dirty_area**: área modificada del widget para marcar como modificada.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10771">**dirty_area**: Dirty area of widget to mark dirty</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10772">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10772">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10773">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Marca correcta del área modificada parcial</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10773">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successful partial dirty area mark</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10774">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10774">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10775">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10775">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10776">**GX_INVALID_WIDGET** (0x12) Widget no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10776">**GX_INVALID_WIDGET**: (0x12) Widget not valid</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10777">**GX_INVALID_SIZE** (0x19) Tamaño no válido del área modificada</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10777">**GX_INVALID_SIZE**: (0x19) Invalid size of dirty area</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10778">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10778">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10779">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10779">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10780">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10780">Example</span></span>

```C
/* Mark widget “my_widget” partial area as dirty. */

status = gx_system_dirty_partial_add(&my_widget,
    &partial_area);

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS the partial area “partial_area”
associated with “my_widget” has been marked as dirty. */
```

## <a name="gx_system_draw_context_get"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10805">gx_system_draw_context_get</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10805">gx_system_draw_context_get</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10806">Obtener contexto de dibujo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10806">Get drawing context</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10807">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10807">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_draw_context_get(GX_DRAW_CONTEXT **current_context);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10808">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10808">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10809">Este servicio devuelve un puntero al contexto de dibujo actual.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10809">This service returns a pointer to the current drawing context.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10810">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10810">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10811">**current_context** puntero al destino del puntero de contexto del dibujo actual</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10811">**current_context**: Pointer to destination for current drawing context pointer</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10812">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10812">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10813">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Obtención correcta del contexto actual</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10813">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successful current context get</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10814">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10814">**GX_PTR_ERROR**:0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10815">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10815">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10816">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10816">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10817">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10817">Example</span></span>

```C
GX_DRAW_CONTEXT *current_context;

/* Get current drawing context. */

status = gx_system_draw_context_get(&current_context);

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS the current drawing context
   is contained in “current_context”. */
```

## <a name="gx_system_event_fold"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10842">gx_system_event_fold</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10842">gx_system_event_fold</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10843">Enviar evento</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10843">Send event</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10844">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10844">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_event_fold(GX_EVENT *event);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10845">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10845">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10846">Este servicio busca en la cola de eventos de GUIX un evento del mismo tipo.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10846">This service searches the GUIX event queue for an event of the same type.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10847">Si existe un evento del mismo tipo, la carga del evento se actualiza para que coincida con el nuevo evento.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10847">If an event of the same type exists, the event payload is updated to match the new event.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10848">Si no se encuentra ningún evento coincidente, se llama a la función gx_system_event_send para agregar el nuevo evento al final de la cola de eventos.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10848">If no matching event is found, the gx_system_event_send function is called to add the new event to the end of the event queue.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10849">Los controladores de entrada rápida táctil suelen usar esta función para impedir que se llene la cola de eventos con varios eventos de PEN_DRAG.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10849">This function is commonly used by fast touch input drivers to prevent filling the event queue with multiple PEN_DRAG events.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10850">La aplicación también puede llamar a esta función para evitar que se agreguen varios eventos del mismo tipo a la cola de eventos de GUIX.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10850">This function can also be called by the application to prevent multiple events of the same type from being added to the GUIX event queue.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10851">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10851">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10852">**event**: puntero al evento.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10852">**event**: Pointer to event</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10853">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10853">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10854">**TX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Envío correcto del evento</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10854">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successful event send</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10855">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10855">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10856">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10856">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10857">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10857">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10858">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10858">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10859">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10859">Example</span></span>

```C
GX_EVENT my_event;

memset(&my_event, 0, sizeof(GX_EVENT));

my_event.gx_event_type = GX_EVENT_PEN_DOWN;

my_event.gx_event_payload.gx_event_pointdata.gx_point_x = 100;
my_event.gx_event_payload.gx_event_pointdata.gx_point_y = 200;

/* Send “my_event” for processing. */
status = gx_system_event_fold(&my_event);

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS the event has been sent for processing. */
```

## <a name="gx_system_event_send"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10884">gx_system_event_send</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10884">gx_system_event_send</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10885">Enviar evento</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10885">Send event</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10886">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10886">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_event_send(GX_EVENT *event);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10887">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10887">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10888">Este servicio envía el evento especificado a la cola de eventos del sistema GUIX.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10888">This service sends the specified event into the GUIX system event queue.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10889">El nuevo evento se coloca al final de la cola.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10889">The new event is placed at the end of the queue.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10890">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10890">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10891">**event**: puntero al evento.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10891">**event**: Pointer to event</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10892">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10892">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10893">**TX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Envío correcto del evento</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10893">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successful event send</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10894">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10894">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10895">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10895">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10896">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10896">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10897">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10897">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10898">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10898">Example</span></span>

```C
/* Send “new_event” for processing. */

GX_EVENT new_event;

new_event.gx_event_target = widget ->gx_widget_parent;
new_event.gx_event_type = MY_EVENT_TYPE;

/* Set optional param. */
new_event.gx_event_payload.xxxx = yyyy
new_event.gx_event_sender = widget->gx_widget_id;

/* Push the event to event pool. */
status = gx_system_event_send(&new_event);

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS the event has been sent for processing. */
```

## <a name="gx_system_focus_claim"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10923">gx_system_focus_claim</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10923">gx_system_focus_claim</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10924">Reclamar foco</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10924">Claim focus</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10925">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10925">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_focus_claim(GX_WIDGET *widget);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10926">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10926">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10927">Este servicio reclama el foco para el widget especificado.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10927">This service claims the focus for the specified widget.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10928">Si el widget no tenía el foco previamente, recibirá un evento GX_EVENT_FOCUS_GAINED.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10928">If the widget did no previously have focus, it will receive a GX_EVENT_FOCUS_GAINED event.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10929">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10929">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10930">**widget**: puntero al bloque de control de widget para reclamar el foco.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10930">**widget**: Pointer to widget control block to claim focus</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10931">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10931">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10932">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Reclamación correcta del foco</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10932">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successful focus claim</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10933">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10933">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10934">**GX_NO_CHANGE** (0x08) El widget ya tiene el foco</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10934">**GX_NO_CHANGE**: (0x08) Widget already owns focus</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10935">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10935">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10936">**GX_INVALID_WIDGET** (0x12) Widget no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10936">**GX_INVALID_WIDGET**: (0x12 Widget not valid</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10937">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10937">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10938">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10938">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10939">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10939">Example</span></span>

```C
/* Claim focus for widget “my_widget”. */
status = gx_system_claim_focus(&my_widget);

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS the focus has been claimed for
   “my_widget”. */
```

## <a name="gx_system_initialize"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10964">gx_system_initialize</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10964">gx_system_initialize</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10965">Inicializar GUIX</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10965">Initialize GUIX</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10966">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10966">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_initialize(VOID);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10967">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10967">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10968">Este servicio inicializa GUIX.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10968">This service initializes GUIX.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10969">Este servicio se debe invocar antes de cualquier otro servicio de API de GUIX y solo se debe invocar una vez al iniciar el sistema.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10969">This service must be invoked before any other GUIX API service, and should only be invoked once at system startup.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10970">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10970">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10971">**None**</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10971">**None**</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10972">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10972">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10973">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Inicialización correcta del sistema</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10973">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successful system initialize</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10974">**GX_SYSTEM_ERROR** (0xFE) Tamaño de bloque de control GX_EVENT no válido o error de creación de evento de cola, exclusión mutua o subproceso</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10974">**GX_SYSTEM_ERROR**: (0xFE) Invalid GX_EVENT control block size or event queue/mutex/thread create failed.</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-10975">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10975">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10976">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10976">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-10977">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10977">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-10978">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-10978">Example</span></span>

```C
/* Initialize GUIX. */
status = gx_system_initialize();

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS, GUIX has been initialized. */
```

## <a name="gx_system_language_table_get"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11003">gx_system_language_table_get</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11003">gx_system_language_table_get</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11004">Recuperar la tabla de idiomas activa</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11004">Retrieve active language table</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11005">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11005">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_language_table_get( 
    GX_CHAR ****language_table,
    GX_UBYTE *languages_count, 
    UINT *string_count);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11006">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11006">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11007">Este servicio recupera la tabla de idiomas activa.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11007">This service retrieves the active language table.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11008">Esta función ha quedado en desuso en favor de gx_display_language_table_get.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11008">This function is deprecated in favor of gx_display_language_table_get.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11009">Todas las aplicaciones nuevas deben usar gx_display_language_table_get.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11009">All new applications should use gx_display_language_table_get.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11010">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11010">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11011">**language_table**: dirección del puntero para devolver la tabla de idiomas.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11011">**language_table**: Address of pointer to return language table.</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11012">**languages_count**: dirección de la variable para devolver las columnas de la tabla.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11012">**languages_count**: Address of variable to return table columns.</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11013">**string_count**: dirección del puntero para devolver las filas de la tabla.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11013">**string_count**: Address of pointer to return table rows.</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11014">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11014">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11015">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Recuperación correcta de la tabla de idiomas activa</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11015">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successfully retrieved active language table</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11016">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11016">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11017">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11017">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11018">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11018">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11019">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11019">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11020">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11020">Example</span></span>

```C
GX_CHAR ***language_table;

GX_UBYTE language_count;

UINT string_count;

/* Retrieve the language table */

status = gx_system_language_table_get(&language_table,
    &language_count, &string_count);
```

### <a name="see-also"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11021">Consulte también</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11021">See Also</span></span>

## <a name="gx_system_language_table_set"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11024">gx_system_language_table_set</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11024">gx_system_language_table_set</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11025">Asignar tabla de idiomas activa</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11025">Assign active language table</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11026">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11026">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_language_table_set(
    GX_CHAR ***language_table,
    GX_UBYTE languages_count, 
    UINT string_count);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11027">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11027">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11028">Este servicio instala la tabla de idiomas activa.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11028">This service installs the active language table.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11029">Esta función ha quedado en desuso en favor de gx_display_language_table_set.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11029">This function has been deprecated in favor of gx_display_language_table_set.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11030">Todas las aplicaciones nuevas deben usar gx_display_language_table_set.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11030">All new applications should use gx_display_language_table_set.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11031">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11031">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11032">**language_table**: puntero a la tabla de idiomas.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11032">**language_table**: Pointer to language table.</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11033">**languages_count**: número de idiomas en la tabla.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11033">**languages_count**: Number of languages in table.</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11034">**string_count**: número de filas de la tabla de cadenas.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11034">**string_count**: Number of string table rows.</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11035">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11035">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11036">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Establecimiento correcto de la taba de idiomas</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11036">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successfully set language table</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11037">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11037">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11038">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11038">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11039">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11039">Allowed From</span></span>

```C
/* Retrieve the language table */

status = gx_system_language_table_set(language_table,
    language_count, string_count);
```


### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11049">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11049">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11050">Este servicio asigna la función de devolución de llamada proporcionada por la aplicación para la asignación y desasignación dinámicas de memoria.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11050">This service assigns the application supplied callback function for dynamic memory allocation and de-allocation.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11051">Si la aplicación no necesita ningún servicio GUIX que use la asignación dinámica de memoria, no es necesario llamar a este servicio.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11051">If no GUIX service that uses dynamic memory allocation is needed by the application, this service does not need to be called.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11052">Si se utiliza, este servicio se debe llamar después de gx_system_initialize(), que borra los punteros de servicio GUIX, y antes de cualquier servicio GUIX que requiera el uso de la asignación dinámica de memoria.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11052">If used, this service should be called after gx_system_initialize() which clears the GUIX service pointers, and before any GUIX service that requires use of dynamical memory allocation.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11053">Los servicios GUIX que requieren una asignación de memoria en tiempo de ejecución y un servicio de desasignación incluyen:</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11053">GUIX services which require a runtime memory allocation and de-allocation service include:</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11054">La carga de recursos binarios desde un almacenamiento externo en el entorno de tiempo de ejecución de GUIX.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11054">Loading binary resources from external storage into the GUIX runtime environment.</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11055">El descodificador de imágenes JPEG en tiempo de ejecución del software.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11055">The software runtime jpeg image decoder.</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11056">El descodificador de imágenes PNG en tiempo de ejecución del software.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11056">The software runtime png image decoder.</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11057">Uso de widgets de texto con GX_STYLE_TEXT_COPY.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11057">Using text widgets with GX_STYLE_TEXT_COPY.</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11058">Funciones de utilidad de cambio de tamaño y rotación de mapa de píxeles en tiempo de ejecución.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11058">Runtime pixemap resize and rotation utility functions.</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11059">Asignación de bloque de control de widget y pantalla en tiempo de ejecución.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11059">Runtime screen and widget control block allocation.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11060">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11060">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11061">**allocator**: función de asignación de memoria.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11061">**allocator**: Memory allocator function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11062">**release**: función liberación de memoria.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11062">**release**: Memory free function</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11063">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11063">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11064">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Asignación correcta de la función de asignación de memoria</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11064">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successfully assigned memory allocate function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11065">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11065">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11066">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11066">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11067">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11067">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11068">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11068">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11069">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11069">Example</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11070">En el ejemplo siguiente se usa un grupo de bytes de ThreadX para implementar un servicio seguro para subprocesos de asignación y desasignación dinámica de memoria.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11070">The following example utilizes a ThreadX byte pool to implement a threadsafe dynamic memory allocation and memory de-allocation service.</span></span>

```C
TX_BYTE_POOL memory_pool;

#define SCRATCHPAD_SIZE (1024 * 4)

ULONG scratchpad[SCRATCHPAD_SIZE];

/* define memory allocation service */

VOID *memory_allocate(ULONG size)
{
    VOID *memptr;

    if (tx_byte_allocate(&memory_pool, &memptr, size, TX_NO_WAIT) == TX_SUCCESS)
    {
        return memptr;
    }
    return NULL;
}

/* define memory de-allocation service */
void memory_free(VOID *mem)
{
    tx_byte_release(mem);
}

/* create byte pool and install our dynamic memory services with GUIX
*/

VOID tx_application_define(void *first_unused_memory)
{
    /* create byte pool for GUIX to use */
    tx_byte_pool_create(&memory_pool, "scratchpad", scratchpad,
        SCRATCHPAD_SIZE * sizeof(ULONG));

    guix_setup();

    /* install our memory allocator and de-allocator */
    gx_system_memory_allocator_set(memory_allocate, memory_free);
}
```

## <a name="gx_system_pen_configure"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11095">gx_system_pen_configure</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11095">gx_system_pen_configure</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11096">Establecer configuración de lápiz</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11096">Set pen configuration</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11097">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11097">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_pen_configure(GX_PEN_CONFIGURATION *pen_configuration);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11098">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11098">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11099">Este servicio establece la configuración del lápiz para controlar los parámetros de velocidad y distancia del lápiz que se usan para desencadenar la generación de tipos de eventos GX_EVENT_FLICK.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11099">This service sets pen configuration to control the pen speed and distance parameters used to trigger the generation of GX_EVENT_FLICK event types.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11100">El miembro gx_pen_configuration_min_drag_dist de GX_PEN_CONFIGURATION es de un tipo de datos de punto fijo, y debe usar GX_FIXED_VAL_MAKE(valor) para convertirlo de INT a GX_FIXED_VAL.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11100">The gx_pen_configuration_min_drag_dist member of GX_PEN_CONFIGURATION is a fixed point data type, and you should use GX_FIXED_VAL_MAKE(value) to convert from INT to GX_FIXED_VAL.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11101">Por ejemplo, si quiere establecer la distancia mínima de arrastre en 0,5 píxeles por tic, tiene que establecer gx_pen_configuration_min_drag_dist en `GX_FIXED_VAL_MAKE(1) / 2`.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11101">For example, if you want to set minimum drag distance to 0.5 pixel per tick, you have to set the gx_pen_configuration_min_drag_dist to `GX_FIXED_VAL_MAKE(1) / 2`.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11102">En GUIX 5.4.0 y versiones anteriores, el miembro gx_pen_configuration_min_drag_dist de GX_PEN_CONFIGURATION era del tipo (INT << 8) en lugar del tipo GX_FIXED_VAL.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11102">In GUIX releases 5.4.0 and older, the gx_pen_configuration_min_drag_dist member of GX_PEN_CONFIGURATION was of (INT << 8) type rather than GX_FIXED_VAL type.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11103">Si el proyecto con la biblioteca de GUIX versión 5.4.0 usa esta API, tendrá que modificar el parámetro min_drag_dist o #define GUIX_5_4_0_COMPATIBILITY al compilar la biblioteca GUIX.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11103">If your project with 5.4.0 version GUIX library is using this API, you will need to modify the min_drag_dist parameter or #define GUIX_5_4_0_COMPATIBILITY when building the GUIX library.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11104">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11104">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11105">**pen_configuration**: puntero a la estructura de configuración del lápiz.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11105">**pen_configuration** Pointer to pen configuration structure.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11106">En el **apéndice I** se incluye la definición de la estructura GX_PEN_CONFIGURATION.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11106">**Appendix I** contains definition to GX_PEN_CONFIGURATION structure</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11107">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11107">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11108">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Establecimiento correcto de la configuración del lápiz</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11108">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successfully set pen configuration</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11109">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11109">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11110">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11110">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11111">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11111">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11112">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11112">Example</span></span>

```C
/* Define pen configuration, set minimum drag distance to 0.5 pixel
per tick, maximum pen speed to 10 ticks. That means GUIX will trigger
a vertical or horizontal flick event if the drag time is smaller than
10 ticks and the drag distance is bigger than 0.5 * drag_ticks. */

GX_PEN_CONFIGURATION pen_configuration;

#if defined(GUIX_5_4_0_COMPATIBILITY)
Pen_configuration.gx_pen_configuration_min_drag_dist = (1 << 8)/ 2;
#else
pen_configuration.gx_pen_configuration_min_drag_dist = GX_FIXED_VAL_MAKE(1) / 2;
#endif

pen_configuration.gx_pen_configuration_max_pen_speed_ticks = 10;

/* Set the pen configuration. */
status = gx_system_pen_configure(&pen_configuration);

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS the touch configure has been set. */
```

## <a name="gx_system_screen_stack_create"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11113">gx_system_screen_stack_create</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11113">gx_system_screen_stack_create</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11114">Crear e inicializar la pila de pantallas del sistema</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11114">Create and initialize the system screen stack</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11115">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11115">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_screen_stack_create(
    GX_WIDGET **memory, 
    INT size);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11116">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11116">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11117">Este servicio define un bloque de memoria que se utilizará para la pila de pantallas del sistema.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11117">This service defines a memory pool to be used for the system screen stack.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11118">La pila de pantallas del sistema es una característica opcional que puede usar la aplicación para administrar la apariencia del flujo de pantalla de la aplicación.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11118">The system screen stack is an optional feature that can be used by the application to manage application screen flow appearance.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11119">Si la aplicación intenta usar los servicios de pila de pantallas, primero se debe llamar a la función gx_system_screen_stack_create para configurar la región de memoria de la pila de pantallas.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11119">If the application intends to utilize the screen stack services, the gx_system_screen_stack_create function must first be called to setup the screen stack memory region.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11120">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11120">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11121">**memory**: puntero al bloque de memoria reservada.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11121">**memory**: Pointer to the reserved memory block.</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11122">**size**: tamaño, en bytes, del bloque de memoria reservada.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11122">**size**: Size, in bytes, of the reserved memory block.</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11123">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11123">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11124">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Creación correcta</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11124">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successfully creation</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11125">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11125">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11126">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11126">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11127">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11127">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11128">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11128">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11129">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11129">Example</span></span>

```C
#define SCREEN_STACK_DEPTH 8
GX_WIDGET *screen_stack[SCREEN_STACK_DEPTH * 2];

UINT status;

/* Get the scrollbar appearance. */

status = gx_system_screen_stack_create(screen_stack,
    sizeof(GX_WIDGET *) * SCREEN_STACK_DEPTH * 2);

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS the system screen stack is initialized
and ready for use. */
```


### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11138">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11138">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11139">Esta función saca los punteros superiores de pila de pantallas y devuelve esos punteros al autor de la llamada.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11139">This function pops the topmost screen stack pointers and returns those pointers to the caller.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11140">Esta función difiere de gx_system_screen_stack_pop() en que la pantalla sacada no se vuelve a asociar automáticamente al elemento primario anterior.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11140">This function differs from gx_system_screen_stack_pop() in that the popped screen is not automatically reattached to the previous parent.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11141">En su lugar, los punteros se sacan de la pila y se devuelven al autor de la llamada, lo que permite que este asocie o descarte la pantalla devuelta según sea necesario.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11141">Instead, the pointers are popped from the stack and returned to the caller, allowing the caller to attach the or discard the returned screen as desired.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11142">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11142">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11143">**popped_parent** ubicación para almacenar el puntero del widget primario.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11143">**popped_parent**: Location to store the parent widget pointer.</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11144">**popped_screen** ubicación para almacenar el puntero de pantalla sacado.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11144">**popped_screen**: Location to store the popped screen pointer.</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11145">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11145">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11146">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Recuperación correcta de los punteros de pila de pantallas</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11146">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successfully retrieval of screen stack pointers</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11147">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11147">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11148">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11148">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11149">**GX_FAILURE** (0x10) Pila de pantallas vacía o no válida</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11149">**GX_FAILURE**: (0x10) Invalid or empty screen stack</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11150">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11150">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11151">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11151">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11152">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11152">Example</span></span>

```C
UINT status;

GX_WIDGET *parent_screen;

GX_WIDGET *popped_screen;

/* Pop a screen stack entry. */
status = gx_system_screen_stack_get(&parent_screen, &popped_screen);

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS, parent_screen and
popped_screen hold the topmost screen stack pointers. */
```

### <a name="see-also"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11153">Consulte también</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11153">See Also</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11154">gx_system_screen_stack_create</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11154">gx_system_screen_stack_create</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11155">gx_system_screen_stack_pop</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11155">gx_system_screen_stack_pop</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11156">gx_system_screen_stack_push</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11156">gx_system_screen_stack_push</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11157">gx_system_screen_stack_reset</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11157">gx_system_screen_stack_reset</span></span>

## <a name="gx_system_screen_stack_pop"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11158">gx_system_screen_stack_pop</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11158">gx_system_screen_stack_pop</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11159">Sacar la entrada superior de la pila de pantallas del sistema</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11159">Pop the topmost entry from the system screen stack</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11160">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11160">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_screen_stack_pop();
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11161">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11161">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11162">Esta función saca la entrada superior de la pila de pantallas y asocia automáticamente la pantalla sacada al widget primario sacado.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11162">This function pops the topmost entry fo the screen stack and automatically attaches the popped screen to the popped parent widget.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11163">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11163">Parameters</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11164">**Ninguna**</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11164">**none**</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11165">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11165">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11166">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Recuperación correcta de los punteros de pila de pantalla</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11166">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successfull retrieval of screen stack pointers</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11167">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11167">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11168">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11168">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11169">**GX_FAILURE** (0x10) Pila de pantallas vacía o no válida</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11169">**GX_FAILURE**: (0x10) Invalid or empty screen stack</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11170">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11170">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11171">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11171">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11172">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11172">Example</span></span>

```C
UINT status;

/* Pop a screen stack entry. */
status = gx_system_screen_stack_pop();

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS, the topmost screen stack entry has been
popped from the stack and re-attached to the previous parent. */
```

### <a name="see-also"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11173">Consulte también</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11173">See Also</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11176">gx_system_screen_stack_push</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11176">gx_system_screen_stack_push</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11177">gx_system_screen_stack_reset</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11177">gx_system_screen_stack_reset</span></span>

## <a name="gx_system_screen_stack_push"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11178">gx_system_screen_stack_push</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11178">gx_system_screen_stack_push</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11179">Insertar un widget y un puntero primario en la pila de pantallas</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11179">Push a widget and parent pointer to the screen stack</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11180">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11180">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_screen_stack_push(GX_WIDGET *screen)
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11181">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11181">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11182">Este servicio coloca un puntero para el widget indicado, que suele ser una pantalla de nivel superior, en la pila de pantallas.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11182">This service places a pointer to the indicated widget, which is usually a top-level screen, onto the screen stack.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11183">Si el widget tiene un elemento primario, se desasocia del elemento primario.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11183">If the widget has a parent it is detached from the parent.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11184">El puntero del widget primario también se inserta en la pila de pantallas.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11184">The parent widget pointer is also pushed to the screen stack.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11185">El widget primario puede ser NULL, lo que significa que se puede insertar en la pila de pantallas una pantalla que no está visible o no está asociada a ningún elemento primario.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11185">The parent widget may be NULL, meaning a screen that is not visible or attached to any parent may be pushed onto the screen stack.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11186">Si se inserta un widget sin un elemento primario en la pila de pantallas, se debe usar la API screen_stack_get() para recuperar el puntero de pantalla insertado, en lugar de usar la API screen_stack_pop(), que intenta volver a asociar el widget sacado a su elemento primario anterior.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11186">If a widget with no parent is pushed to the screen stack, the screen_stack_get() API should be used to retrieve the pushed screen pointer, rather than using the screen_stack_pop() API, which attempts to reattached the popped widget to its previous parent.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11187">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11187">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11188">**screen**: puntero al widget que se va a insertar en la pila de pantallas.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11188">**screen**: Pointer to the widget to be pushed to the screen stack.</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11189">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11189">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11190">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Obtención correcta de la apariencia de la barra de desplazamiento</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11190">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successfully get scrollbar appearance</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11191">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11191">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11192">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11192">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11193">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11193">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11194">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11194">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11195">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11195">Example</span></span>

```C
/* Get the scrollbar appearance. */
status = gx_system_screen_stack_push(window);

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS, the widget pointed to by “window” has
been pushed to the screen stack, along with the widget’s parent
ponter. */
```

### <a name="see-also"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11196">Consulte también</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11196">See Also</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11197">gx_system_screen_stack_get</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11197">gx_system_screen_stack_get</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11198">gx_system_screen_stack_pop</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11198">gx_system_screen_stack_pop</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11199">gx_system_screen_stack_create</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11199">gx_system_screen_stack_create</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11200">gx_system_screen_stack_reset</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11200">gx_system_screen_stack_reset</span></span>

## <a name="gx_system_screen_stack_reset"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11201">gx_system_screen_stack_reset</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11201">gx_system_screen_stack_reset</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11202">Restablecer la pila de pantallas del sistema</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11202">Reset the system screen stack</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11203">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11203">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_screen_stack_reset();
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11204">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11204">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11205">Esta función quita todas las entradas de la pila de pantallas del sistema.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11205">This function removes all entries from the system screen stack.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11206">Si las pantallas sacadas de la pila tienen bloques de control asignados dinámicamente por GUIX Studio, se libera la memoria de esos bloques de control.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11206">If the screens popped from the stack have dynamically allocated control blocks allocated by GUIX Studio, the memory for those control blocks is freed.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11207">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11207">Parameters</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11208">**Ninguna**</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11208">**none**</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11209">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11209">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11210">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Obtención correcta de la apariencia de la barra de desplazamiento</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11210">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successfully get scrollbar appearance</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11211">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11211">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11212">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11212">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11213">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11213">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11214">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11214">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11215">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11215">Example</span></span>

```C
/* Get the scrollbar appearance. */
status = gx_system_screen_stack_reset();

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS the system screen stack has been cleared
of entries. */
```

### <a name="see-also"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11216">Consulte también</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11216">See Also</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11217">gx_system_screen_stack_get</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11217">gx_system_screen_stack_get</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11219">gx_system_screen_stack_push</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11219">gx_system_screen_stack_push</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11220">gx_system_screen_stack_create</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11220">gx_system_screen_stack_create</span></span>

## <a name="gx_system_scroll_appearance_get"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11221">gx_system_scroll_appearance_get</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11221">gx_system_scroll_appearance_get</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11222">Obtener apariencia de desplazamiento</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11222">Get scroll appearance</span></span>

### <a name="prototype"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11223">Prototipo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11223">Prototype</span></span>

```C
UINT gx_system_scroll_appearance_get(
    ULONG style,
    GX_SCROLLBAR_APPEARANCE *return_appearance);
```

### <a name="description"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11224">Descripción</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11224">Description</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11225">Este servicio obtiene la apariencia de la barra de desplazamiento.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11225">This service gets the scrollbar appearance.</span></span>

### <a name="parameters"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11226">Parámetros</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11226">Parameters</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11227">**style**: estilo de la barra de desplazamiento: `GX_SCROLLBAR_HORIZONTAL` o `GX_SCROLLBAR_VERTICAL`.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11227">**style**: Scrollbar style: `GX_SCROLLBAR_HORIZONTAL` or `GX_SCROLLBAR_VERTICAL`</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11228">**return_appearance**: puntero al destino de la apariencia.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11228">**return_appearance**: Pointer to destination for appearance.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11229">En el **apéndice I** se incluye la definición de la estructura GX_SCROLLBAR_APPERANCE.</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11229">**Appendix I** contains definition to GX_SCROLLBAR_APPERANCE</span></span>

### <a name="return-values"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11230">Valores devueltos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11230">Return Values</span></span>

- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11231">**GX_SUCCESS** (0x00) Obtención correcta de la apariencia de la barra de desplazamiento</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11231">**GX_SUCCESS**: (0x00) Successfully get scrollbar appearance</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11232">**GX_CALLER_ERROR** (0x11) Autor de la llamada de esta función no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11232">**GX_CALLER_ERROR**: (0x11) Invalid caller of this function</span></span>
- <span data-ttu-id="46d97-11233">**GX_PTR_ERROR** (0x07) Puntero no válido</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11233">**GX_PTR_ERROR**: (0x07) Invalid pointer</span></span>

### <a name="allowed-from"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11234">Permitido desde</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11234">Allowed From</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="46d97-11235">Inicialización y subprocesos</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11235">Initialization and threads</span></span>

### <a name="example"></a><span data-ttu-id="46d97-11236">Ejemplo</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="46d97-11236">Example</span></span>

```C
GX_SCROLLBAR_APPEARANCE my_appearance;

/* Get the scrollbar appearance. */

status = gx_system_scroll_appearance_get(style, &my_appearance);

/* If status is GX_SUCCESS “my_appearance” now contains the scroll
appearance. */
```
